title: 3D Interactive Anatomy Exploration: Understanding Cervical Spine Structures

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Blended classroom environment combining laboratory settings and tablet devices, introducing 3D interactive content to overcome limitations of 2D material learning.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify the seven bony structures of the cervical spine by manipulating a 3D interactive model.
Learners can explain the spatial relationships of major nerves/vessels connected to the cervical spine from at least three different angles.
Learners can analyze pathological cases of the cervical spine using digital tools and simulate them with 3D models.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
